org.threadly.litesockets

Interface Client.Reader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SSLClient
    Enclosing class:
    Client

    public static interface Client.Reader
    This is the Reader Interface for clients. Any client with this set will call .onRead(client) when a read is read from the socket. These will happen in a single threaded manor for that client. The thread used is the clients thread and should not be blocked for long. If it is the client will back up and stop reading until it is unblocked. The implementor of Reader should always call "client.getRead()" once and only once. If not you risk either reading data to early or causing the reader to be behind a packet. If the same Reader is used by multiple clients each client will call the Reader on its own thread so be careful what objects your modifying if you do that.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onRead(Client client)
      When this callback is called it will pass you the Client object that did the read.

    • Method Detail

      • onRead

        void onRead(Client client)
        When this callback is called it will pass you the Client object that did the read. .getRead() should be called on once and only once before returning. If it is failed to be called or called more then once you could end up with uncalled data on the wire or getting a null.
        Parameters:
        client - This is the client the read is being called for.
